decks.notes: The main concept of this Aluren combo deck is to efficiently use cards like Academy Rector, Spellseeker, and Recruiter of the Guard to find and play Aluren, which allows you to play your creatures for free. With the help of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, you can maximize the value of your enter the battlefield triggers from creatures like Ukkima, Stalking Shadow and Baleful Strix. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's gameplan while maintaining card advantage and board presence. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to control the game and answer threats efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional disruption and value. The deck also features a strong mana base with Arcum's Astrolabe and various fetchlands to ensure consistent access to its powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Snare. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, while generating card advantage and filtering through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, Oko, Thief of Crowns provides versatility by being able to handle problematic threats or create additional threats of its own.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold deck is to apply early pressure and disruption through a mix of low-cost spells and efficient creatures. Utilizing powerful cards like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Hooting Mandrills, the deck aims to aggressively control the game and chip away at the opponent's life total. With a strong suite of countermagic and removal spells, as well as the ability to generate card advantage through cantrips and Oko, Thief of Crowns, the deck seeks to maintain tempo and momentum in order to secure victory.

This Death & Taxes deck focuses on disrupting opponents by playing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth while also utilizing cards like Sanctum Prelate and Phyrexian Revoker to control the opponent's spells and abilities. Additionally, the deck includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to help push damage quickly. With a solid mana base including Wasteland and Rishadan Port, this deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan effectively.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat in creatures and maintain board presence. The deck also includes equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to provide additional threats and value. The mana denial package of Wasteland and Rishadan Port further hampers opponents' ability to develop their board, creating openings for this aggro strategy to capitalize on.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using the card Doomsday to set up a winning combo by carefully arranging the top cards of your library. The deck includes a variety of spells to help you dig through your deck and protect your combo, along with key creatures like Thassa's Oracle and Baleful Strix to help you win the game once you've executed the Doomsday pile. It also includes a mix of lands to support the color requirements of your spells and ensure you have the mana you need to execute your combo efficiently.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing out Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Plague Engineer. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while using cards like Eldrazi Displacer to control the board. The deck also utilizes lands like Cavern of Souls and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate its game plan. Overall, the deck's key concept is to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan with efficient Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Elves combo deck is to quickly generate mana with cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while also drawing cards and playing multiple creatures in a turn with Glimpse of Nature. The deck aims to make use of its mana advantage to cast powerful cards like Natural Order to search for game-ending threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also utilizes key cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and generate additional mana, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of elves.

The primary focus of this deck is to use the synergy between the Elves creatures and various spells such as Natural Order, Green Sun's Zenith, and Glimpse of Nature to quickly generate mana and flood the board with creature tokens. Once enough creatures are out, the deck aims to use Craterhoof Behemoth to deliver a massive, game-ending boost in power and toughness to all creatures. The deck utilizes a combination of mana acceleration, card draw, and efficient creatures to set up and execute this combo win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to use low-cost creatures like Changelings and Ornithopter in combination with Ninja creatures like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to consistently deal damage to the opponent quickly. Support cards like Retrofitter Foundry and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and disruption, while cards like Force of Will and Daze help to protect the aggressive game plan. The deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, creating a fast-paced and unpredictable playstyle.

The main concept of the deck is to use Show and Tell to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Omniscience onto the battlefield for free. The deck includes multiple ways to find and manipulate these cards, such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Cunning Wish. It also includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The mana base includes lands that can produce multiple colors and provide additional mana, such as City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently play out powerful threats by cheating them into play with cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. Key cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Phyrexian Dreadnought can easily win the game if put into play. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle to protect its combo. Oko, Thief of Crowns and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value and protection, making it a versatile and deadly combo deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the powerful combo of cheating out big threat creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck includes cantrips like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands, fetch lands, and fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and City of Traitors to support the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to use the cards Show and Tell and Sneak Attack to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play ahead of schedule. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig through the deck and find the combo pieces, along with countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with massive threats early in the game. The mana base includes efficient lands like City of Traitors and Lotus Petal to speed up the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently generate a large amount of mana using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual. By utilizing these cards effectively, the deck is able to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to build up storm count and eventually win the game with Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Chain of Vapor to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is well-tuned to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistent performance.
